post_text: Who is 100% mobile LLC practice and has PO box rather than use home address? What other options are there for business mail and LLC registration requires address.

comments.text:
I am (S corp though, can't have LLCs in CA). I have a UPS box but I might swithc over to a "virtual mailbox" soon.

From an online search: A virtual mailbox for an LLC provides a real street address for receiving and managing business mail remotely, without the need for a physical office. It's a cost-effective way to maintain a professional presence, separate personal and business mail, and manage mail online. Several virtual mailbox providers, like Bizee, Anytime Mailbox, Planet Express, PostScan Mail, and iPostal1, offer this service.
I use iPostal1. It's $14.99/month and my address is at a Staples. It's been great for me going on almost 3 years now.

full_thread_text:
POST: Who is 100% mobile LLC practice and has PO box rather than use home address? What other options are there for business mail and LLC registration requires address.

COMMENT 1: I am (S corp though, can't have LLCs in CA). I have a UPS box but I might swithc over to a "virtual mailbox" soon.

From an online search: A virtual mailbox for an LLC provides a real street address for receiving and managing business mail remotely, without the need for a physical office. It's a cost-effective way to maintain a professional presence, separate personal and business mail, and manage mail online. Several virtual mailbox providers, like Bizee, Anytime Mailbox, Planet Express, PostScan Mail, and iPostal1, offer this service.

COMMENT 2: I use iPostal1. It's $14.99/month and my address is at a Staples. It's been great for me going on almost 3 years now.

post_text: Can I offer online PT services across state lines? What are the rules I need to get caught up on with this? Any advice is helpful!

comments.text:
You need to have a license where the patient is located, if you're providing physical therapy services.

Check out the PT Compact to see if it would be useful for your circumstances.
You need to have a license in the state the patient is in

full_thread_text:
POST: Can I offer online PT services across state lines? What are the rules I need to get caught up on with this? Any advice is helpful!

COMMENT 1: You need to have a license where the patient is located, if you're providing physical therapy services.

Check out the PT Compact to see if it would be useful for your circumstances.

COMMENT 2: You need to have a license in the state the patient is in

post_text:
üì¢ ADVOCACY REQUEST!! üì¢ 

If you are a practicing PT, OT, or SLP you likely are aware that Medicare plans to eliminate our ability to provide services via telehealth starting 1/1/25. For the past four years, my team and I have been able to provide pain management services to underserved and rural populations in Maryland because of telehealth. In fact, an article in MedPage Today from Nov. 27th highlighted that the rates of chronic pain have INCREASED since the onset of the opioid epidemic--from about 20% to 24%--and that healthcare SHOULD be leveraging technology to reach those who cannot access effective and appropriate care. 

Unless Congress intervenes in the next couple of weeks, this Medicare mandate will become permanent. Today, I am asking all of my fellow PTs, OTs, and SLPs to consider advocating for the continuance of telehealth services. Your voice DOES matter, I promise! Please click/copy paste the link below associated with your respective area of practice, select the "Make Telehealth Access Permanent," and submit your request to your congressional representatives. This whole process should take about 2 minutes. Thank you!

AOTA: https://www.votervoice.net/AOTA/Home
APTA: https://www.apta.org/advocacy/take-action/patient-action-center
ASHA: https://www.asha.org/advocacy/takeaction/
full_thread_text:
POST: üì¢ ADVOCACY REQUEST!! üì¢ 

If you are a practicing PT, OT, or SLP you likely are aware that Medicare plans to eliminate our ability to provide services via telehealth starting 1/1/25. For the past four years, my team and I have been able to provide pain management services to underserved and rural populations in Maryland because of telehealth. In fact, an article in MedPage Today from Nov. 27th highlighted that the rates of chronic pain have INCREASED since the onset of the opioid epidemic--from about 20% to 24%--and that healthcare SHOULD be leveraging technology to reach those who cannot access effective and appropriate care. 

Unless Congress intervenes in the next couple of weeks, this Medicare mandate will become permanent. Today, I am asking all of my fellow PTs, OTs, and SLPs to consider advocating for the continuance of telehealth services. Your voice DOES matter, I promise! Please click/copy paste the link below associated with your respective area of practice, select the "Make Telehealth Access Permanent," and submit your request to your congressional representatives. This whole process should take about 2 minutes. Thank you!

AOTA: https://www.votervoice.net/AOTA/Home
APTA: https://www.apta.org/advocacy/take-action/patient-action-center
ASHA: https://www.asha.org/advocacy/takeaction/

post_text:
Hey guys, I‚Äôm in a season of life where I can no longer run my own practice. I ended up closing about 2 years ago to stay home with my kids. I was planning on going back to a PRN or part time position in the fall, however, my 8 month old has spina bifida so anything outside of the home is out since we will not be putting her in any sort of childcare. Does anyone know of any remote work I can do in the field other than telehealth visits?

Editing to add: I‚Äôm licensed in Texas.

comments.text: Check with PT programs, esp the hybrid ones. They usually are looking for adjuncts and there are some roles that are completely remote.

Does anyone know of any remote work I can do in the field other than telehealth visits?

Editing to add: I‚Äôm licensed in Texas.

COMMENT 1: Check with PT programs, esp the hybrid ones. They usually are looking for adjuncts and there are some roles that are completely remote.

post_text:
TAKING PAYMENTS

I'm looking for a service that will let me take payments:
- in person with a card
- online via invoice 
- online, as able (paying toward their balance as able)
- online, in a set payment plan for one total sum (must be able to set the repayment period options myself)
- online, with automatically recurring charges for subscription plans

I currently use Square and it's been just fine, but I want to offer folks more options and let them be able to see their remaining balance. I don't think there's a way to do that with Square, but I'm happy to be corrected!

comments.text: Hey! I believe you can do all of this (with the exception of paying as able, which you may be able to) on square. I do almost all of it currently.

full_thread_text:
POST: TAKING PAYMENTS

- in person with a card
- online via invoice 
- online, as able (paying toward their balance as able)

- online, with automatically recurring charges for subscription plans

I currently use Square and it's been just fine, but I want to offer folks more options and let them be able to see their remaining balance. I don't think there's a way to do that with Square, but I'm happy to be corrected!

COMMENT 1: Hey! I believe you can do all of this (with the exception of paying as able, which you may be able to) on square. I do almost all of it currently.

post_text:
Can someone answer some questions about the PT Compact for me? 
If you want to practice in another state via telehealth, you pay the state‚Äôs compact fee and take whatever test they require, and you are good to practice, correct? What about maintaining requirements? Do you have to do specific CEUs for that state? Do you have to pay the compact fee every 2 years to relicense? Are there any stipulations on practicing via telehealth? Thanks!!

comments.text:
If you don‚Äôt live in the compact state, I don‚Äôt believe you can join the compact at all is my understanding? I‚Äôll be following this to see if it‚Äôs different, but that would be fantastic.
I do not live in a compact state and yes, I have obtained licensure in multiple other states individually. You pay each fee for each state separately and each state has different requirements.

full_thread_text:
POST: Can someone answer some questions about the PT Compact for me? 
If you want to practice in another state via telehealth, you pay the state‚Äôs compact fee and take whatever test they require, and you are good to practice, correct? What about maintaining requirements? Do you have to do specific CEUs for that state? Do you have to pay the compact fee every 2 years to relicense? Are there any stipulations on practicing via telehealth? Thanks!!

COMMENT 1: If you don‚Äôt live in the compact state, I don‚Äôt believe you can join the compact at all is my understanding? I‚Äôll be following this to see if it‚Äôs different, but that would be fantastic.
I do not live in a compact state and yes, I have obtained licensure in multiple other states individually. You pay each fee for each state separately and each state has different requirements.

post_text:
Currently sitting in my "morning office" before I migrate up to my "productive office" (dress code is knit booties)

Hanging out in this group over the last few months, I've noticed a big trend:

A lot of you spend tons of **time, energy and money on patient acquisition** on the front end and then basically do next to nothing for them when they are done with care.

Sure there are some folks to "never discharge", but how can we turn an industry inside joke into a way to make **more money, in less time?**

You're going to love the webinar I put together all about my specialty: remote, subscription based wellness programs.

Click on the link below to sign up for the webinar! (May 11 at 8pm est)

[https://bit.ly/41XnD07](https://bit.ly/41XnD07?fbclid=IwAR0YyMm8K-Ea1AXJCWuZ-L1VC9SVOobIBd-S4tI9K0ZW9CnAP6G2EpqsAt4)

P.S. With the info from my webinar, youll be able to implement this remote wellness program as early as the next morning

comments.text: So true!! It‚Äôs like sporting events and concerts that have ‚Äútraffic directors‚Äù to get people into the parking lots efficient, but have nothing to assist after the show
Looking forward to this Joe Camoratto

post_text:
Anyone in NJ practicing via Telehealth? If so, how many sessions do you perform in this forum? Are you in network ( if so with which insurances)? Out of network? 

I've read our practice act and see that it has to be reasonable as per clinician and wanted to see if this was a practical option to have in my clinic.

comments.text:
I offer both mobile and telehealth services. I'm private pay only. 
At one point all of my pts were virtual (and seeing great outcomes) but there has been a shift in the last 9 months and most have been looking for in person. 
The ones who have been open to telehealth have had reservations initially but quickly see how effective they can be... and then # of sessions will depend on their goals just like any in person session.  On average 5-12 sessions I'd estimate. 

Happy  to chat further!
Harsh Prajapati & Laurie Hutt Katz might be able to help

full_thread_text:
POST: Anyone in NJ practicing via Telehealth? If so, how many sessions do you perform in this forum? Are you in network ( if so with which insurances)? Out of network? 

I've read our practice act and see that it has to be reasonable as per clinician and wanted to see if this was a practical option to have in my clinic.

COMMENT 1: I offer both mobile and telehealth services. I'm private pay only. 
At one point all of my pts were virtual (and seeing great outcomes) but there has been a shift in the last 9 months and most have been looking for in person. 
The ones who have been open to telehealth have had reservations initially but quickly see how effective they can be... and then # of sessions will depend on their goals just like any in person session.  On average 5-12 sessions I'd estimate. 

Happy  to chat further!

COMMENT 2: Harsh Prajapati & Laurie Hutt Katz might be able to help

post_text:
Hello! I have been sitting in the shadows but I think I‚Äôm finally ready to start my own online and travel business. I know treating across state boarders can be tricky but I have seen plenty of great approaches to achieving this. Would some of you mind sharing how you go about virtual treatment over state lines as well as how you word things for your evaluations/treatments. Do you call it coaching? Or training? Also what are you charging for evaluations and follow ups (currently located in New England area) and does this change for in person vs virtual? Fill me in please! 

Thank you :)

comments.text: I don't treat across state lines but I would keep your prices the same for in person or virtual. Your time is your time, period.

full_thread_text:
POST: Hello! I have been sitting in the shadows but I think I‚Äôm finally ready to start my own online and travel business. I know treating across state boarders can be tricky but I have seen plenty of great approaches to achieving this. Would some of you mind sharing how you go about virtual treatment over state lines as well as how you word things for your evaluations/treatments. Do you call it coaching? Or training? Also what are you charging for evaluations and follow ups (currently located in New England area) and does this change for in person vs virtual? Fill me in please! 

Thank you :)

COMMENT 1: I don't treat across state lines but I would keep your prices the same for in person or virtual. Your time is your time, period.

post_text:
First take of my social media intro video and photos of my new location:

Please if you are willing to watch the video give me some feedback. Also if you have anything positive or helpful criticism to say about the photos that‚Äôs great too.

Update: Thanks for all the feedback everyone. I‚Äôm going to get some branded shirts made and make a series of videos instead like some people have suggested. My goal will be to limit the main intro video to 5 min or less and each follow-up side video to 2.5 min or less.

comments.text: I would be a little more upbeat during the video, especially at the very beginning‚Äîyou want to exude excitement right off the bat and get people interested. Nice place! Looks great. A few other suggestions: make the video more concise/short 11 mins is long for a potential patient to watch all the way through, wear something branded to showcase your business. Good luck!

Thank you for your service! üá∫üá∏I love your mindset on exercise, inclusivityüè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà, reaching goals of your clients! The clinic looks great! Shorter video, have a couple 1 min videos to highlight treatment areas and large gym. Hire a professional to film. Need a mic for better audio and filming needs editing. Fill the gym up with clients, friends working out, need music too. Will you have other staff? Add special effects/text in video to drive home key points, visual impact. You want to invoke emotion for action, I think most people only have attention of 1 min to get your message then they swipe. You are very brave to put yourself out there for feedback. Good luck!! üëäüèæüëäüèºüëäüèø

full_thread_text:
POST: First take of my social media intro video and photos of my new location:

Please if you are willing to watch the video give me some feedback. Also if you have anything positive or helpful criticism to say about the photos that‚Äôs great too.

Update: Thanks for all the feedback everyone. I‚Äôm going to get some branded shirts made and make a series of videos instead like some people have suggested. My goal will be to limit the main intro video to 5 min or less and each follow-up side video to 2.5 min or less.

COMMENT 1: I would be a little more upbeat during the video, especially at the very beginning‚Äîyou want to exude excitement right off the bat and get people interested. Nice place! Looks great. A few other suggestions: make the video more concise/short 11 mins is long for a potential patient to watch all the way through, wear something branded to showcase your business. Good luck!

COMMENT 2: Thank you for your service! üá∫üá∏I love your mindset on exercise, inclusivityüè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà, reaching goals of your clients! The clinic looks great! Shorter video, have a couple 1 min videos to highlight treatment areas and large gym. Hire a professional to film. Need a mic for better audio and filming needs editing. Fill the gym up with clients, friends working out, need music too. Will you have other staff? Add special effects/text in video to drive home key points, visual impact. You want to invoke emotion for action, I think most people only have attention of 1 min to get your message then they swipe. You are very brave to put yourself out there for feedback. Good luck!! üëäüèæüëäüèºüëäüèø
